caseStudies.title: Redesigning Education Access for Communities First Foundation
caseStudies.shortDescription: A complete digital transformation that increased student enrollment by 300% and improved accessibility scores to 98/100.

challenge.overview: Communities First Foundation provides educational resources to underserved communities, but their outdated website created barriers for the very people they aimed to serve. With a confusing navigation structure, poor mobile experience, and failing accessibility standards, they were losing potential students and donors.

painPoints.description: Most users accessed the site from smartphones, but the unresponsive design made it nearly unusable on small screens.
Screen readers couldn't navigate the site, excluding vision-impaired users from accessing educational resources.
A lengthy, confusing enrollment process caused 75% of interested students to abandon the form.
Despite serving a multilingual community, the website offered no translation options.

challenge.context: The foundation had been using the same website framework since 2015, with band-aid fixes applied over the years. Leadership recognized that their digital presence was no longer serving their mission.

approach.methodology: We employed a community-centered design process, starting with extensive user research involving students, parents, educators, and donors. Every design decision was tested with real users before implementation.

processSteps.title: Discovery & Community Engagement
processSteps.description: Conducted interviews with 45 community members, ran usability tests on the existing site, and analyzed user behavior data. Held community workshops to understand needs and barriers.

processSteps.title: Strategy & Information Architecture
processSteps.description: Developed a new site structure based on user mental models, simplified navigation, and created clear pathways for different user types (students, donors, volunteers).

processSteps.title: Design & Prototyping
processSteps.description: Created mobile-first wireframes and high-fidelity designs with a warm, welcoming aesthetic. Prioritized accessibility with AAA color contrast and clear visual hierarchy.

processSteps.title: Development & Integration
processSteps.description: Built a responsive Next.js website with Sanity CMS, enabling the foundation's staff to update content easily. Integrated with existing enrollment and donation systems.

processSteps.title: Testing & Quality Assurance
processSteps.description: Rigorous testing across devices, browsers, and assistive technologies. Conducted accessibility audits and performance optimization.

processSteps.title: Launch & Training
processSteps.description: Phased rollout with staff training on content management, ongoing monitoring, and rapid iteration based on real-world usage.

collaboration.clientStakeholders: Executive Director, Program Manager, Communications Lead, 3 community advisors

solution.overview: We delivered a fully responsive, WCAG AAA-compliant website with a modern design system, intuitive navigation, and seamless content management. The new platform puts students and families first, with clear pathways to enrollment, resources, and support.

deliverables.name: Responsive Website
deliverables.description: Mobile-first Next.js application with server-side rendering for fast load times

deliverables.name: Content Management System
deliverables.description: Sanity Studio with custom schemas, enabling non-technical staff to publish content

deliverables.name: Multilingual Support
deliverables.description: English and Spanish versions with easy content translation workflow

deliverables.name: Enrollment System Integration
deliverables.description: Streamlined 3-step enrollment form connected to existing student database

deliverables.name: Resource Library
deliverables.description: Searchable, filterable collection of educational materials with download tracking

deliverables.name: Design System
deliverables.description: Comprehensive component library and style guide for future consistency

impact.overview: The results exceeded all expectations. Within three months of launch, the foundation saw dramatic increases in enrollment, engagement, and donations. Most importantly, they received heartfelt feedback from families who said they finally felt welcomed and included.

metrics.context: increase in program applications within 3 months
up from 25% on the old site
more than doubled donation completion rate

testimonial.quote: This website transformation didn't just improve our digital presence—it fundamentally changed how we serve our community. We've heard from families who said they finally felt seen and welcomed. The accessibility improvements mean we can truly serve everyone, and the enrollment numbers speak for themselves. This is what equity-centered design looks like in action.
testimonial.author: Maria Rodriguez

impact.longTermImpact: Six months post-launch, the foundation has served 450 new students, raised $185,000 through online donations, and recruited 120 new volunteers—all through their website. The CMS empowers their team to publish weekly success stories and resources, keeping the community engaged and informed.

caseStudies.title: Building Trust Through Transparency: HealthBridge Nonprofit Rebrand
caseStudies.shortDescription: A comprehensive rebrand and digital platform that restored public trust and increased donor retention by 62% through radical transparency.

challenge.overview: HealthBridge, a healthcare advocacy nonprofit, faced a crisis of trust after leadership changes and unclear communication about fund allocation. Donor retention dropped to 38%, and media coverage questioned their effectiveness.

painPoints.description: Existing donors were leaving due to lack of transparency and unclear impact reporting.
Inconsistent messaging and visual identity made the organization feel disorganized and untrustworthy.
Donors couldn't see where their money went or what outcomes it achieved.
Annual report PDFs and infrequent email updates failed to engage modern donors.

impact.overview: The rebrand and transparency platform restored confidence. Donors responded powerfully to the honest, data-driven storytelling, and HealthBridge regained its reputation as a leading healthcare advocate.

metrics.context: retention rate up from 38% to 61% in 6 months
monthly active users exploring impact data
shift from negative to 78% positive coverage

testimonial.quote: Equity by Design helped us face our challenges head-on. Instead of hiding from tough questions, we embraced transparency. The new brand and platform don't just look good—they embody our commitment to accountability. Our donors are coming back because they can finally see the real impact of their support.
testimonial.author: Dr. James Chen

caseStudies.title: Amplifying Indigenous Voices: Cultural Heritage Digital Archive
caseStudies.shortDescription: A co-created digital archive platform that centers Indigenous knowledge, supports language revitalization, and has reached 85,000 community members globally.

metrics.context: oral histories, songs, and cultural knowledge pieces
schools using the archive in curriculum

testimonial.quote: This project honored our way of knowing and sharing. The design team listened deeply, learned from our elders, and created a platform that feels like home. Our stories are being passed to the next generation in a way that respects tradition while embracing modern technology. This is cultural preservation done right.
testimonial.author: Grandmother Willow Star
